urls.title: New interactive map reveals the truth about sewage pollution - The Rivers Trust
urls.description: Yesterday, the Guardian revealed that water firms discharged raw sewage into England‚Äôs rivers 200,000 times in 2019. Michelle Walker, our Head of GIS, described the data as ‚Äúvery alarming‚Äù. She said: ‚ÄúWhen you look at the detail, you see that some of these locations are releasing untreated sewage hundreds of times a year, so they [‚Ä¶]

tweets.text: @dickiewood @SkiptonAngling @ProfJGrey @BradfordCityAA @WildTroutTrust @EnvAgencyYNE @HeritageFundNOR @YorkshireWater @CravenHerald Yes and too often. In 2019, the sewer storm overflow upstream of this spot spilled 212 times for a total of 386 hours, discharging into the Waller Hill Beck. You can explore your local beck at https://t.co/LipvRnuJdX

urls.title: Wastewater is 'polluting rivers with microplastic'

@PJennings88 @EnvAgency As yesterday's Manchester University research confirmed.

"To produce such high levels of [plastics] contamination, [they] must be releasing wastewater into low flows - so when there isn't heavy rain."

https://t.co/neO7mzoVRf
